result.execSummary:
The defendant Calla Anne Hook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court finds defendant statutorily eligible for CIP & SAP.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, fees, DNA surcharge and $250.00 buy money.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample by 9-2-15.  Pay DNA surcharge.

No alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Prescriptions must be approved by agent in advance.
No contact with N.P.
No contact with T.K. except for treatment.
May not be in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

Comply with terms and conditions of Drug Court.
Undergo assessments and counseling as recommended by agent.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED
To be used as sanctions in Drug Court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
